alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Macon; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 5:44PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following counties, Jackson, Macon and Swain. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - In particular, stream flows will be elevated on Greens Creek and Betty Branch as they flow toward the Tuckasegee River, and along Cowee Creek and Huckleberry Creek as they flow toward the Little Tennessee River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Savannah and Alarka. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
